AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States-Mexico border: geographical boundary used as a factor in determining reasonable suspicion for United States Border Patrol stops
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals: a court that has noted the order of vehicles in a smuggling venture is not significant and provides guidance on reasonable suspicion for traffic stops
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: Conducts roving stops and may temporarily detain vehicles for investigation, governed by the standard articulated in the reasonable suspicion doctrine, with proximity to the United States-Mexico border being a vital element
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Echo 43 checkpoint: checkpoint on Highway 59 where United States Border Patrol agents were stationed, within fifty miles of the Mexico border
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.black Dodge pickup truck: vehicle driven by IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and subject to a canine search, encountered by Agent Trevino within fifty miles of the United States-Mexico border
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.white Malibu sedan: vehicle stopped by Agent Trevino on Farm-to-Market Road 2050, transporting illegals, and traveling in tandem with the black Dodge pickup truck
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol agents: agents who encounter illegal aliens and are familiar with local vehicles, recognizing approximately 90-95% of them as belonging to farmers and oil field workers
